title: demonica
author: demonica
content: So while browsing on TikTok, I've seen a video explaining about Bitcoin and how it works with a cartoon-style animation. It's pretty basic information and it was explained in a simple way, making it easy to understand for beginners who want to know or explore Bitcoin. Actually, I find an animation style of explaining what Bitcoin is and how it works easily. It also catches the attention of other people who aren't into it. Also, with this style, it won't be too boring to understand Bitcoin. It might just be a brief explanation but compared to when you're just reading some explanation online, this is more interesting. What do you think?Code:https://www.tiktok.com/@bitcoinclipped/video/7229010170821528858

It also catches the attention of other people who aren't into it. Also, with this style, it won't be too boring to understand Bitcoin. comments.body: That's a pretty nice animation and actually gives you a good idea if you don't know Bitcoin, I don't know whose the audience of this animation but I guess this wasn't actually coming from Tiktok Maybe the video was just posted by a guy on TikTok since most of their contents didn't really come from him.I mean it's a great Bitcoin promotion the animation explains it well and anyone who watches this show might be interested and might invest in Bitcoin in the future or at least know Bitcoin. comments.author: Asiska02
comments.body: Quote from: demonica on May 05, 2023, 12:48:01 PMActually, I find an animation style of explaining what Bitcoin is and how it works easily. It also catches the attention of other people who aren't into it. Also, with this style, it won't be too boring to understand Bitcoin. It might just be a brief explanation but compared to when you're just reading some explanation online, this is more interesting. What do you think?That must be a great way to teach bitcoin, but I still believe it cannot cover all of the information needed to understand about bitcoin. Learning about bitcoin is not a child’s play and requires complete focus in order to grasp the concept completely. Illustrating in a cartoon is not a bad idea, but it has a lot of constraints that are unnecessary when learning about it. However, word-for-word or step-by-step factual information regarding bitcoin is more vital and beneficial to use than an animated film.

comments.author: Darker45
comments.body: I'm actually not sure if Satoshi Nakamoto really created Bitcoin because he/she/they were "fed up with government money" and "the corruption, the manipulation." Although Satoshi made some unfavorable remarks as to fiat's design and flaws, nowhere in the whitepaper did Satoshi mention that Bitcoin is a solution to government's failures. As a matter of fact, I particularly like how the whitepaper appears pretty much neutral. If one is to read the whitepaper and appreciate it vis-à-vis the strong statements made by enthusiastic Bitcoin supporters against governments, one might begin to wonder whether they're on the same page. Bitcoin was created to solve a real-world problem; it was designed in such a way as to "allow online payments to be sent directly from one party to another without going through a financial institution."[1][1] https://bitcoin.org/bitcoin.pdf

comments.author: Pmalek
comments.body: It's a good animation and easy to understand. I like how they never show the face of the character playing satoshi, adding to the mystery surrounding him/her/them. I will show it to some of the younger people I know to see what they think about it.Quote from: Darker45 on May 06, 2023, 04:09:15 AMI'm actually not sure if Satoshi Nakamoto really created Bitcoin because he/she/they were "fed up with government money" and "the corruption, the manipulation." Although Satoshi made some unfavorable remarks as to fiat's design and flaws, nowhere in the whitepaper did Satoshi mention that Bitcoin is a solution to government's failures. The genesis block contains a message explaining how the government is about to bailout banks a second time. At the same time, ordinary people were losing their homes, pensions, and bank savings. Bitcoin is meant as an alternative to fraudulent banks and their government bailout buddies who will help them in times of crisis, but wouldn't mind seeing you and your family become homeless in the process.

The point I'm trying to make is that the video should not just explain how to learn about or explore bitcoin, but it should also explain the risks involved, so that those who are free to do so can join and those who are unwilling to take the risk can leave.
